comments.text:
Okay, so here's my theory based on theory comments above/below.

Puppy cat is the space-out-law who was transformed into a "horrible 
monster", (his current form), hence temp-bot saying "you look different." I 
think Bee is the Space princess. I think the princess changed her 
appearance and wiped her memory of all events that happened, and created 
her new persona, Bee. The reason Puppycat fell out of the sky onto Bee is 
because he was looking for the princess. When he realized Bee was the 
princess, he got mad at her father for the way she was now living, because 
he thought she deserved better. When Bee stated she ran out of food money, 
Puppycat felt bad for her, and got the temp job. Pulling evidence from the 
next episode, you can see that Puppycat puts up with bee's silly ness, even 
if he doesn't like it, because only the people you love will put up with 
you like that. Evidence I have to support bee being the princess is the way 
she rushed to help him without thinking. She didn't hesitate to help, and 
this may have been just because it would be wrong to just stand there, but 
bee had said "I'm going to kill you," showing she really cares for puppy 
cat. The evidence I have for Puppycat being the out law is the outlaws 
hairstyle, (cat ears), and the fish, Wallace, talking about it not being a 
fairy tail. ("I knew it was you, pretending it's just a story, lying to 
children, and making him look up to a hero that, in reality, is just an 
awful monster.") 

This is just a theory, (head cannon), I put together with other peoples

comments.text:
+GHSouls First of all, animation requires a lot of time, dedication and 
money. For a ten minute animation, the plot is very concrete. It's the 
first episode, it's not meant to be finished. At least I don't think the 
creator wanted to finish the whole story with just this, due to the 
kickstarter project they have going on.

It's supposed to make you think and leave you with mystery, that's why 
puppycat told that story and you got a glimpse of his reflection at the end.

Regarding the sword, it's a magical transformation of course they wouldn't 
show how she "made" it because she didn't, it was magic. That's why it's 
called a magical transformation.

Although you may not know what's going on, the main character of this story 
doesn't know either, it did happened suddenly but her reactions are due to 
her personality which, from the beginning have been placid no matter what 
she's facing in her life (except for her crush, which is understandable).

 Not to mention how vague you are being with what you wanted in the show, 
not everyone shows the same interest in a show and not everyone who likes 
it is on tumblr. That's a very closed minded way of thinking.

comments.text:
A Vocaloid is a voice synthesis program to create songs, sometimes 
dialogue, with. In this case, Power FX's English Vocaloid, Oliver, was used 
as Puppycat's voice. That's why Puppycat sounded well when singing, though 
a bit awkward when speaking. Oliver wasn't credited because he is property 
of Yamaha and Power FX, and permissions would be needed to credit him. 
Anyway, Vocaloid and Utau are wonderful singing programs and I suggest 
learning more:

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vocaloid
www.vocaloid.com
vocaloid.wikia.com

comments.text:
+coolyin ! Idk, I don't really think it's 'fatphobic' (which is an awfully 
silly term to be honest) to criticize the new design. I can't say I like it 
a ton either. I can't even tell if she's supposed to be chubby or if it's 
just, like, anime inspired chibi stylization. There's a lot less contrast 
and subtlety to the design now. She's kind of just...a bunch of clunky 
rounded off squares and huge circular hair. It's also kind of off-putting 
that she looks so young now, I was kind of digging the aimless 20-something 
look. But that's just my opinion! Feel free to disagree. Also calling 
someone gross is rude. :U

Extra weight on a character can totally work for a design - look at Greg, 
Steven, Amethyst, and Rose in Steven Universe. They've got lovely designs. 
But something about Bee just feels off, I suppose. :0

comments.text:
+rushdrift
There are many *different* companies that make many *different* vocaloids 
(like zero G, POWER FX, We've inc, crypton, Bplats, moeJapan, ....*more*....) 
also the original vocaloids are - *Leon and Lola* (they where the first and 
they where english not Japanese and not miku, she's not even the first for 
vocaloid 2 -*Sweet Ann* is

Wanna *sit down* and count count all the *official* vocaloids, with *all 
companies* also listed, *knock yourself out* *^__^* - 
http://vocaloid.wikia.com/wiki/Status
There are *60+* in existence *not* counting *fanloids* and *utaus*

There are *three generations* Worth of vocaloids from *2004 to now(2014) 
(the software is already 10 years old)* crypton only made *"the big six"* *Miku, 
Rin, len, meiko, kaito, and Luka* they did not make gumi or gakupo

Even *yumaha, the owners of the vocaloid software*, make *there own*, like 
anon, kanon, v flower and mew

Also the English vocaloids (*like Oliver and yohioloid*), the Spanish (*Bruno 
and Clara*), the Chinese (*Luo and yanhe*), the Korean (*SEEU*), the 
Japanese (*mew and rana*) are all made by *different companies* that are 
not crypton and are separate from each other...

you must be *new* to the fandom to only think Miku and the cryptonloids are 
the only *official* vocaloids *T_T* (because that's what they normally 
do...)

Just sayin'

comments.text:
+Annie Rong , Puppycat is NOT the space outlaw. He's the Space King. That's 
why he's always calling people peasant and demanding that they bow to him.

The outlaw is a good guy, only an outlaw because he defied the evil king 
(Puppycat).

The story goes like this--- and yes, I'm certain.
The King (Puppycat) did not want to give his daughter away to the outlaw.
So, he tried using his warlocks to deceive the outlaw into being trapped.

The outlaw's sense of betrayal turned the magic on the King and his 
warlocks, turning them all into monsters.

THIS is why Bee dreams of multiple Puppycats- the warlocks were also 
turned; those are them.

Puppycat is the bad guy. This is why he slits Bee's wrists in her dream.
This is why he tortures the cicada. This is why he smacks a crow out of its 
nest. This is why he tries to buy an arsenal at the store.

The other puppycat monsters in Bee's dreams are the King's warlocks, whose 
magic turned on them.

The demon pretending to be Wallace in Fishbowl Space was one of the King's 
warlocks. He calls Puppycat a liar because Puppycat is claiming it was the 
outlaw who was turned into a monster, when it was really the king and his 
warlocks.

The reason that Puppycat is pursued by his warlocks is because they blame 
him for turning them into monsters.

This is because the warlocks weren't all in favor of the King's plan, but 
he forced them into it.

When Puppycat sees a reflection of the outlaw in the end of the pilot, he's 
not looking at his own reflection wistfully... he's looking at it 
spitefully... because he's ruminating.

The plot follows Puppycat as Bee makes him a better person over time.

I'll bet money that everything I'm saying is correct.

comments.text:
Puppycat, Wallace, and the space outlaw are 3 different beings. Puppycat 
somehow knows the plight of the outlaw and while babysitting Wallace, the 
space outlaw overhears Puppycat telling his story in the form of a fairy 
tale. The space outlaw is angered by this and uses the evil magic he has 
(perhaps aquired when he was turned into a monster) to take control of 
Wallace's actions for a couple seconds (like Swayze using Whoopi's body in 
Ghost), then he exits Wallace's body, fairly graphically, showing his true 
form and points out the fact that Puppycat was turning his story into a 
fairy tale, lying to children (Wallace), telling them it is just a story. 
Pretty simple, but I had to watch it a couple times to realize what was 
happening. Of course I could be wrong, but I don't see much evidence that 
the outlaw is Puppycat or Wallace.

comments.text:
I hope they go back to the way it is in the pilot. Considering the influx 
of fans and tons of fanart and excitement for this pilot when it came out, 
compared to the disapointed reactions for the newer episodes i think they 
could bounce back ten fold if they went back to this tone and style for the 
show. Everything from the animation, Bee's characterization and appearance, 
the random surprise of walace, puppycat's backstory. I get the slow build, 
but episodes that seem random should give us information into a deeper 
backstory, even if it feels vague. Kind of like the way it was done in this 
episode, wallace gave information (aside from the song) and it was even 
implied the evil wizards in disguise may be out to kill puppycat. But in 
recent episodes i felt they didnt do enough of that information giving. If 
you look at episodes of steven universe you get those random episodes but 
there is usually some point in them, they arent entirely random but give 
you subtle clues about a deeper plot. I guess its only 2 episodes in, so it 
is early still so maybe that aspect is still being built. Still, i miss the 
tone of this pilot. That first scene in the rain everything about that had 
me hooked. That is the tone i feel is missing. The continuing series, its 
got the goofy childish parts but its missing that cynical mature side to 
balance it out. And the animation they have here and the art style just has 
its own unique vibe about it, i wish they didnt trade it in for that steven 
universe esque style they have now.
comments.author: Wabbu Babbu

top_comment.text:
Okay, so here's my theory based on theory comments below.

Puppy cat is the space-out-law who was transformed into a "horrible 
monster", (his current form), hence temp-bot saying "you look different." I 
think Bee is the Space princess. I think the princess changed her 
appearance and wiped her memory of all events that happened, and created 
her new persona, Bee. The reason Puppycat fell out of the sky onto Bee is 
because he was looking for the princess. When he realized Bee was the 
princess, he got mad at her father for the way she was now living, because 
he thought she deserved better. When Bee stated she ran out of food money, 
Puppycat felt bad for her, and got the temp job. Pulling evidence from the 
next episode, you can see that Puppycat puts up with bee's silly ness, even 
if he doesn't like it, because only the people you love will put up with 
you like that. Evidence I have to support bee being the princess is the way 
she rushed to help him without thinking. She didn't hesitate to help, and 
this may have been just because it would be wrong to just stand there, but 
bee had said "I'm going to kill you," showing she really cares for puppy 
cat. The evidence I have for Puppycat being the out law is the outlaws 
hairstyle, (cat ears), and the fish, Wallace, talking about it not being a 
fairy tail. ("I knew it was you, pretending it's just a story, lying to 
children, and making him look up to a hero that, in reality, is just an 
awful monster.") 

This is just a theory, (head cannon), I put together with other peoples 
theory's and facts from the episode. Tell me what you think, and if I have 
and holes I can fill in. Open to suggestions. :)﻿

comments.text:
From my previous statement, might as well of just renamed Bee to a 
different character. Her character isn't realistic or interesting anymore. 
(I mean personality wise, I don't care about the design.)
I expanded on this in my previous comment.
Yes pilot's aren't meant to be the final design, but remember, people 
funded for the pilot. They were paying for something they wanted. Yes, they 
should of expected some changes to happen, but I don't think anyone 
expected this.

I'm not hating by the way, I love watching Bee and Puppycat, but I just 
wanted to give some of my feedback. 
This comment may appear as hostile to some, but I just want to spread my 
opinions.

If their old "pilot quality" was too time demanding. then I'd rather wait. 
Best to wait for a good product than to have an "ok" one shoveled around 
every month.

TL:DR
People who funded the project should have gotten what they payed for. Yes 
designs change from the pilot, but certain elements were favored and should 
have stayed.

Most fans would rather wait for good content than have "Meh" ones given to 
them within a few weeks.

My message to Cartoon Hangover and the Bee and Puppy Cat team:

  I'm not a butthurt fan. Your stuff is good, but elements from the pilot 
should be involved in future episodes. Fans were excited off what they were 
shown, and they enjoyed it. The only logical reason I conclude from the 
change would be time-restraints. (Being lazy etc)

Many of us would want to wait for better content. However, this is just my 
opinion.

Thanks for reading this much, and you're awesome if you read all of it.

comments.text:
Yeah I find that everytime I watch a new episode I come back to watch this 
one again. I think part of it is because I'm trying to convince myself the 
pilot wasn't THAT amazing and I'm being too hard on the new stuff; but 
every time I'm wrong and the pilot is as amazing as I remember it. For me 
it's not just the art either, there's a shift in the comedy from the odd 
non-sequitor to complete randomness, the voice actors all have the same 
bored tone of voice (whereas if you listen to Deckard in the pilot it's 
clearly not that tone), and Bee's character has gone from zany and 
irresponsible, to stupid. 

I backed the kickstarter on the strength of the pilot, and what they have 
produced is not necessarily a bad show, but not one I would have donated 
$130 towards. I also have an issue with how preemptively merchandised the 
show is - like I'm wondering how much of the kickstarter went to the actual 
animation (which at 9 x 5 minute episodes, will only be 45 minutes all up), 
and how much went to merchandising. As a perfect example, if you look at 
the episode 3 comments, you can see Frederator plugs the Cleavage crab toy 
a lot in the comments - not only do they already have a toy - on the day 
the episodes released - but there's also a whole series of cleavage crab 
merchandise available on their store site (and don't even get me started on 
the backer rewards issue).
comments.author: MsSRemy
